programme.title: Junkyard Empire

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: (1985) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. To free his kidnapped daughter, an ex US commando must agree to assassinate a South American president. But he's not as pliant as he seems...

programme.title: The Empty Man
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural horror about a deadly ghoul that can be conjured by blowing across an empty bottle on an empty bridge. Can a world-weary ex-cop stop the apparently inevitable bloodshed?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: (1957) Classic western with Glenn Ford and Van Heflin. The capture of a murderous stagecoach robber propels an impoverished local rancher on a perilous journey. Directed by Delmer Daves.

programme.title: Arthur's Hallowed Ground
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy drama. Jimmy Jewell stars as a cricket groundsman whose dream is to produce a pitch of billiard table perfection. But he finds himself at odds with the club committee.

programme.title: Lawrence of Arabia
programme.desc: (1962) David Lean's Oscar-winning epic. Peter O'Toole stars as TE Lawrence - the charismatic officer who united feuding Arab tribes to fight the Turks in WWI.

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Dennis Quaid and Jake Gyllenhaal. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi disaster with Halle Berry. A NASA bigwig, a disgraced astronaut and a conspiracy theorist are all that stand between the Earth and a plummeting Moon. But are aliens involved?

programme.title: The Shape of Water
programme.desc: (2017) Guillermo del Toro's Oscar-winning romantic fantasy stars Sally Hawkins as a mute cleaning lady who develops feelings for a mysterious, aquatic humanoid while working in a lab.

programme.title: Frank
programme.desc: (2014) Comedy-drama about the experiences of a man who joins an avant-garde rock group. Starring Michael Fassbender, Domhnhall Gleeson and Maggie Gyllenhaal. Sex/drugs/very strong language.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: (2019) Animated adventure featuring the voices of Jennifer Garner, Mila Kunis, John Oliver and Matthew Broderick. A girl's imaginary theme park comes to life when her mum goes to hospital.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: (1964) Sci-fi starring Lionel Jeffries. An eccentric Victorian inventor builds the first spacecraft to land on the moon, which is inhabited by ant-like beings - animated by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. With no sign of struggle and carbon monoxide poisoning ruled out, a mysterious will that leaves everything to their daughter and a family friend points police in a new direction

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Shivi Ramoutar makes fresh peamole on toast with smoked salmon and poached egg for this morning's guest Nicki Chapman and Jimmy Doherty joins in a celebration at the wildlife park for Arthur the camel's birthday. Local artist Lydia also shows how to block print

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: The musician visits Victoria and the city of Melbourne, where he catches up with friend Dannii Minogue, as well as an acclaimed barista for an award-winning cup of coffee

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which Dennis, Kate and the reigning champion are presented with clues in the form of answers and must phrase their responses in the form of a question

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Gill from Huntingdon, Edward from Nottingham, Aiden from South Shields and Rushelle originally from Leicester come together in the hope that as a team they can take on The Chaser and leave with thousands of pounds

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Noah delivers some alarming news, the police gather suspects, and Dawn and Jimmy are horrified by the scene

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lauren lays a trap for her blackmailer, Mick plays a prank on Liam, Carl suggests Debbie needs some extra help, and Todd discovers Millie vandalised the Shuttleworth's hearse

programme.title: Martin Clunes' Islands of the Atlantic
programme.desc: Martin heads to Madeira, where he takes a lesson in rallying on steep mountain roads that are perfect for the sport, and hears about the fate of Prince Renato II on an old sea fort that was once a tiny island in the main port of Funchal. He then visits the archipelago of the Azores, tasting the unique local dish of cozido das furnas on Sao Miguel, and learning about the history of whaling on Faial before heading out with one of the island's best skippers in search of sperm whales

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the hit US TV series, starring Denzel Washington. On the face of it, Robert McCall is just an ordinary guy who works at a DIY store and leads a quiet life. But when McCall befriends a young girl controlled by ruthless Russian gangsters, he's unable to stand idly by and resorts to using skills from his shady former career.

programme.title: Martin Clunes' Islands of the Atlantic
programme.desc: The actor embarks on an epic journey to explore the ocean's islands, beginning with tropical jungles and grassland savannah off the western coast of Africa. He encounters giant snails and helps rescue endangered sea turtles in equatorial Sao Tome and Principe, which is also known as the African Galapagos. He then treks through savannah on the remote Bijagos Islands off Guinea Bissau to meet ferocious predators and a tribe in which the women hold the power

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Join Katie in her self-built space for resetting and relaxing in - as she and Toby Tarrant try some belly dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas transforms another charity founder.

programme.title: A Year in the Beacons
programme.desc: Summer arrives and the mountain rescue team are inundated with call-outs, while Lord of the Manor Harry tries to bring business back to the estate and the Phillips family of farmers return their flock to the mountain

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan has a chat on the farm with actor Larry Lamb, TV screenwriter Lynda La Plante and presenter Kirsty Gallacher. Camilla Bassett-Smith demonstrates how to plant vegetables, there's a catch-up with shepherdess Susie Parish's litter of border collie pups and Jonathan Phang introduces the guests to the best of British drinks

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by Strictly Come Dancing professional Vito Coppola, who samples tiramisu-inspired overnight oats. Jimmy joins in with feeding time for the arctic wolves at the wildlife park, and the gang makes cupcakes before Vito's dance skills are tested by a morris dancing group

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and serves up a feast of delicious food for model Jodie Kidd, while also enjoying recipes from chefs Aktar Islam, Emily Scott, and Corrin Harrison

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Prue is joined in her kitchen by fashion designers Vin and Omi, the people responsible for putting her on a catwalk in a latex dress. After Omi cooks up his grandma's chicken curry, Prue revives a taste from the past in the form of devilled mushrooms and kidneys on toast, while her husband John pays a visit to a butcher to buy meat and learn how to twist sausages

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Lingfield
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the Derby and Oaks Trials from Lingfield Park, plus the Victoria Cup from Ascot and the Swinton Handicap Hurdle from Haydock Park. Analysis comes from Jason Weaver and Leonna Mayor, reports by Mick Fitzgerald and Oli Bell, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges. Bizarre new game Flush or Float is showcased, before the host takes a trip to Milton Keynes to give away 1,000 via In for a Penny, In for a Grand

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Jasmine Harman, Helen Lederer, Jamie Borthwick and Neil Delamere pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: Adam and Ryan Thomas host the final round of the game show as the eight remaining player try to avoid being eliminated. They must catch a butterfly in a net, stack a series of boxes, sharpen pencils and more as seven of them are sent packing, leaving the champion to take the 25,000 prize

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent: Live Semi-Final
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the third semi-final as eight more acts that made it through the audition rounds perform in front of the judges and a live audience for a chance of a place in the final. Judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli, as well as presenters Ant and Dec, have the power to send one act straight through to the grand final with the golden buzzer, before the audience votes for their favourite act, who will gain the second place

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Birdie declines a co-worker's offer to conduct a background check on Joe before a trip. When Joe is called away during the break due to a family emergency, he arranges a night at a luxury hotel for Birdie that is soured by sad news and a glimpse of his ulterior motives

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper and Sandra Bullock. A demented extortionist's plan to collect a huge ransom by planting a bomb in an LA skyscraper is thwarted by the reckless bravery of SWAT daredevil Jack Traven. Undeterred, the unhinged bomber sets Traven a sterner test - an even more deadly device on board a commuter-filled bus that will explode if the bus's speed drops below 50mph.

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: David Tennant takes part in the innovative interview show in which he is questioned by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent and/or learning disabled. Does he believe in God? How did it feel to lose his parents? Does he know how to vogue? From his skincare regime to his cancelled friend, no subject is out of bounds

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
programme.desc: This Morning presenter Alison Hammond carries on the legacy left by the much-loved Paul O'Grady by heading to Battersea Dogs and Cats Home to help the canines find new forever homes. A stray lurcher with a fractured leg captures Alison's heart and she meets an over-friendly golden retriever in desperate need of some social skills. Alison puts a pair of portly jack russells who need to shed a few pounds through boot camp

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Rachel, found in a battered carry cot in Euston Station's long-stay car park and known as the 'Euston Baby', and Steve, who doesn't actually know where or when he was found and has no records before the age of nine months, search for their families

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Lincoln for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and serves up a feast of delicious food for model Jodie Kidd, while also enjoying recipes from chefs Aktar Islam, Emily Scott, and Corrin Harrison

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by food writer and Great British Bake Off judge Prue Leith to try hula hooping and boogie bouncing, while hairdresser Michael Douglas transforms the style of another charity founder

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined musical theatre star Elaine Paige and author and broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles, while falconer Alan Greenhalgh shows off some birds of prey. Chris Hull demonstrates how to create a magical secret garden and Andy Clarke has some musical-inspired martinis in honour of Elaine

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan showcases the beauty of the cherry blossom and Japanese maple as he takes seasonal inspiration from his own garden. Claire Lowrie gives advice on saving tired houseplants and Camilla Basset-Smith explores an arts and crafts garden. Henry Agg demonstrates how to build a DIY plant support and Errol Reuben Fernandes joins a community green space in the Midlands to help bring their wildlife-friendly bog garden to life

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Prue is joined in her kitchen by fashion designers Vin and Omi, the people responsible for putting her on a catwalk in a latex dress. After Omi cooks up his grandma's chicken curry, Prue revives a taste from the past in the form of devilled mushrooms and kidneys on toast, while her husband John pays a visit to a butcher to buy meat and learn how to twist sausages

programme.title: Peter Pan
programme.desc: Adaptation of JM Barrie's classic fantasy adventure, starring Jason Isaacs, Jeremy Sumpter and Rachel Hurd-Wood. London, the early 1900s: young Wendy Darling is visited by a boy with the ability to fly who persuades her and her brothers to join him on an adventure to the magical world of Neverland. There they encounter the evil Captain Hook and the jealous fairy Tinker Bell.

programme.title: Matilda
programme.desc: Comic fantasy based on the book by Roald Dahl, starring Mara Wilson and Danny DeVito. Matilda, the daughter of Harry and Zinnia Wormwood, has adored reading from a precociously early age, but her parents refuse to let her go to school. Until, that is, her father sends her to the unforgiving Miss Trunchbull's Crunchem Hall, where she discovers that she has other more useful gifts.

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: Adam and Ryan Thomas host the final round of the game show as the eight remaining player try to avoid being eliminated. They must catch a butterfly in a net, stack a series of boxes, sharpen pencils and more as seven of them are sent packing, leaving the champion to take the 25,000 prize

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts another charity edition of the game show, with Darren Harriott, Laura Jackson and Will Mellor trying to say what they see as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a 50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with the four lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: The MIU refuses to concede to pressure from the hospital's trust while looking closer into previous complaints that might shed light on the truth, but just how far will the trust go to protect itself? Suspicion turns once again to James Ford after his actions on his night out are revealed, and Kate is forced to make a decision as both the doctor and the MIU race to track down midwife Maria Carter

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Taken 2
programme.desc: Action sequel starring Liam Neeson. Former CIA agent Bryan Mills plans a few days in Istanbul with his daughter and ex-wife. But the father of a kidnapper he killed is hellbent on revenge and so once again the lives of Mills and his family are in peril.

programme.title: Vicky McClure: My Grandad's War
programme.desc: In this one-off special to mark the anniversary of D-Day, the actress embarks on an emotional journey with her 97-year-old grandfather, Ralph, to learn about his role in the most extraordinary single day of the Second World War. Vicky sets out to understand how Ralph - then still a teenager from Nottingham - found himself in the Royal Navy and at the centre of a world-changing battle on the Normandy beaches on June 6, 1944. The pair visit the only surviving example of the type of landing craft he trained and crossed the Channel on, and discover aerial pictures believed to show his flotilla landing at Normandy - before travelling back to the beach he last visited almost 80 years ago

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. With no sign of struggle and carbon monoxide poisoning ruled out, a mysterious will that leaves everything to their daughter and a family friend points police in a new direction

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: The MIU refuses to concede to pressure from the hospital's trust while looking closer into previous complaints that might shed light on the truth, but just how far will the trust go to protect itself? Suspicion turns once again to James Ford after his actions on his night out are revealed, and Kate is forced to make a decision as both the doctor and the MIU race to track down midwife Maria Carter

programme.title: The Assembly

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which Dennis, Kate and the reigning champion are presented with clues in the form of answers and must phrase their responses in the form of a question

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Gill from Huntingdon, Edward from Nottingham, Aiden from South Shields and Rushelle originally from Leicester come together in the hope that as a team they can take on The Chaser and leave with thousands of pounds

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Noah delivers some alarming news, the police gather suspects, and Dawn and Jimmy are horrified by the scene

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lauren lays a trap for her blackmailer, Mick plays a prank on Liam, Carl suggests Debbie needs some extra help, and Todd discovers Millie vandalised the Shuttleworth's hearse

programme.title: Martin Clunes' Islands of the Atlantic
programme.desc: Martin heads to Madeira, where he takes a lesson in rallying on steep mountain roads that are perfect for the sport, and hears about the fate of Prince Renato II on an old sea fort that was once a tiny island in the main port of Funchal. He then visits the archipelago of the Azores, tasting the unique local dish of cozido das furnas on Sao Miguel, and learning about the history of whaling on Faial before heading out with one of the island's best skippers in search of sperm whales

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the hit US TV series, starring Denzel Washington. On the face of it, Robert McCall is just an ordinary guy who works at a DIY store and leads a quiet life. But when McCall befriends a young girl controlled by ruthless Russian gangsters, he's unable to stand idly by and resorts to using skills from his shady former career.

programme.title: Vicky McClure: My Grandad's War
programme.desc: In this one-off special to mark the anniversary of D-Day, the actress embarks on an emotional journey with her 97-year-old grandfather, Ralph, to learn about his role in the most extraordinary single day of the Second World War. Vicky sets out to understand how Ralph - then still a teenager from Nottingham - found himself in the Royal Navy and at the centre of a world-changing battle on the Normandy beaches on June 6, 1944. The pair visit the only surviving example of the type of landing craft he trained and crossed the Channel on, and discover aerial pictures believed to show his flotilla landing at Normandy - before travelling back to the beach he last visited almost 80 years ago

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which Dennis, Kate and the reigning champion are presented with clues in the form of answers and must phrase their responses in the form of a question

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Gill from Huntingdon, Edward from Nottingham, Aiden from South Shields and Rushelle originally from Leicester come together in the hope that as a team they can take on The Chaser and leave with thousands of pounds

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Noah delivers some alarming news, the police gather suspects, and Dawn and Jimmy are horrified by the scene

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lauren lays a trap for her blackmailer, Mick plays a prank on Liam, Carl suggests Debbie needs some extra help, and Todd discovers Millie vandalised the Shuttleworth's hearse

programme.title: Martin Clunes' Islands of the Atlantic
programme.desc: Martin heads to Madeira, where he takes a lesson in rallying on steep mountain roads that are perfect for the sport, and hears about the fate of Prince Renato II on an old sea fort that was once a tiny island in the main port of Funchal. He then visits the archipelago of the Azores, tasting the unique local dish of cozido das furnas on Sao Miguel, and learning about the history of whaling on Faial before heading out with one of the island's best skippers in search of sperm whales

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the hit US TV series, starring Denzel Washington. On the face of it, Robert McCall is just an ordinary guy who works at a DIY store and leads a quiet life. But when McCall befriends a young girl controlled by ruthless Russian gangsters, he's unable to stand idly by and resorts to using skills from his shady former career.

programme.title: Martin Clunes' Islands of the Atlantic
programme.desc: The actor embarks on an epic journey to explore the ocean's islands, beginning with tropical jungles and grassland savannah off the western coast of Africa. He encounters giant snails and helps rescue endangered sea turtles in equatorial Sao Tome and Principe, which is also known as the African Galapagos. He then treks through savannah on the remote Bijagos Islands off Guinea Bissau to meet ferocious predators and a tribe in which the women hold the power

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Join Katie in her self-built space for resetting and relaxing in - as she and Toby Tarrant try some belly dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas transforms another charity founder.

programme.title: A Year in the Beacons
programme.desc: Summer arrives and the mountain rescue team are inundated with call-outs, while Lord of the Manor Harry tries to bring business back to the estate and the Phillips family of farmers return their flock to the mountain

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan has a chat on the farm with actor Larry Lamb, TV screenwriter Lynda La Plante and presenter Kirsty Gallacher. Camilla Bassett-Smith demonstrates how to plant vegetables, there's a catch-up with shepherdess Susie Parish's litter of border collie pups and Jonathan Phang introduces the guests to the best of British drinks

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by Strictly Come Dancing professional Vito Coppola, who samples tiramisu-inspired overnight oats. Jimmy joins in with feeding time for the arctic wolves at the wildlife park, and the gang makes cupcakes before Vito's dance skills are tested by a morris dancing group

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Prue is joined in her kitchen by fashion designers Vin and Omi, the people responsible for putting her on a catwalk in a latex dress. programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the Derby and Oaks Trials from Lingfield Park, plus the Victoria Cup from Ascot and the Swinton Handicap Hurdle from Haydock Park. Analysis comes from Jason Weaver and Leonna Mayor, reports by Mick Fitzgerald and Oli Bell, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

They must catch a butterfly in a net, stack a series of boxes, sharpen pencils and more as seven of them are sent packing, leaving the champion to take the 25,000 prize

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent: Live Semi-Final
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the third semi-final as eight more acts that made it through the audition rounds perform in front of the judges and a live audience for a chance of a place in the final. Judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli, as well as presenters Ant and Dec, have the power to send one act straight through to the grand final with the golden buzzer, before the audience votes for their favourite act, who will gain the second place

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: Fake

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper and Sandra Bullock. A demented extortionist's plan to collect a huge ransom by planting a bomb in an LA skyscraper is thwarted by the reckless bravery of SWAT daredevil Jack Traven. Undeterred, the unhinged bomber sets Traven a sterner test - an even more deadly device on board a commuter-filled bus that will explode if the bus's speed drops below 50mph.

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: David Tennant takes part in the innovative interview show in which he is questioned by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent and/or learning disabled. Does he believe in God? How did it feel to lose his parents? Does he know how to vogue? From his skincare regime to his cancelled friend, no subject is out of bounds

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
